Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn M
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with Motel. Clean and spacious. Great having a fridge and microwave. Staff were very helpful and any problems immediately addressed. Well located to restaurants of reasonable prices. Breakfast at the Sizzlin Grill every morning was so reasonable. Easy commute by car to Disney and other theme parks. Nice swimming pool although we only got to use it once as we swam in the water parks. Good nights sleep and comfortable bed. Thought it was very good value for money and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Super 8”
Reviews.Author: Dawn C
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at this wonderful hotel!!! Thanks a million Super 8!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney World adventures”
Reviews.Author: Sallie R
Reviews.Content: Found this Super 8 online prior to our Disney World trip. Front desk very helpful and nice. Room was spacious, clean, and well kept. Disney World parks were a quick trip - very convenient. Good restaurants nearby. Breakfast was okay - bagels, muffins, juice. Price was very reasonable given the proximity to Disney World parks. Quiet area - comfortable beds. Would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Joan W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of February. Picked this motel from internet.Didn't think it would amount to much. Had trouble with microwave,went to the night clerk thinking it would be the next day at the soonest, within 10 minutes he was there , took me to a empty room to cook the popcorn. Next day we had a new microwave.Great service, day clerk was very helpful and always had time to talk and answer our questions.Rooms were nice sized and clean,nice TV. Quiet,lots of places including Old Town to walk to. This is our all time future staying place. Thank You Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: WestIndian4ever
Reviews.Content: Looks like a motel from the outside but: - Newly refurbished rooms with new furnishings and flat screen TV...very surprising for a super 8. - Free Wifi - Bus stop close by that takes you to several malls and disney world for $2 - extremely helpful staff - complimentary breakfast - vending machine on site - Denny's right next door - McDonalds, Chinese restaurant and loads of other dining options in walking distance - countless flea markets close by, less than 5 mins walk. I have stayed in hotels that cost 5 times as much and do not have the room quality and service as this motel

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: utahjamie
Reviews.Content: We stay there in March 2012, the room was older but clean, the staff was helpful and friendly. Not fancy but located across the street from Old Town and you can walk from the room to anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: deedee2368
Reviews.Content: My family stay here was exceptional !!!!! Starting with the service over the phone helping me to locate the place. The gentleman on the phone was so kind, friendly, made me laugh a lot and helpful. Checking in was quick and friendly. The room was clean. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was good. Pool was crystal clear and clean. Property was well kept. Service was always with a smile.....even when I thought I lost my wallet they were so helpful in their attempt of helping me to locate my wallet.....found it in my bags.....hahaha. Lastly their price per night was awesome. This was a great and wonderful place to stay. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good but ...”
Reviews.Author: ScotVA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Super 8 several times. The rooms are very nice for a Super 8: nice bedding, nice wide screen TV, minifridge, small microwave, usually good wifi but tends to go down. DO NOT eat the cheerios. One of the mornings I was there the man behind the desk came out, picked up all those cheerios that had spilled on the counter and then put them back in the container for others to eat. DISGUSTING. Maybe you don't want to eat anything else there that human hands could have touched. The coffee is also very weak. Denny's out front. Dunkin Donuts close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, less than 10 minutes from Disney”
Reviews.Author: CM0187
Reviews.Content: I went on a mini vacation with my mother and boyfriend to Disney. The original plan was to stay with the family we were meeting up there at their hotel but it was waaay to expensive. After looking around and deciding that what we were looking for was just a bed to sleep in after a day of fun, we ended up staying here. And what a great place!! On the second night my mother asks, "How much was the room?" "$85" "A night?" "The full 3 days" She was truly in shock. The room was spotless, and the beds were super comfortable. It was truly the best sleep I have ever had in a bed that wasn't my own. I recommend this place for anyone looking for something that's easy on the pocket, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Win W
Reviews.Content: Clean, updated rooms, WI-FI service was good, house keeping was efficient. Front staff was courtious and helpful. Good value for money paid. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: litlbitartsy
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased on our recent stay at this Super 8. It was in a good location too with a lot of stores, restaurants, and Disneyworld. The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and very helpful. The room was clean, refridge, microwave, flat screen tv, fast internet wifi. The bathtub showed some wear but was clean.. the rest of the room appeared to have been recently updated. The beds were comfortable. We stayed on rhe ground floor, backside which didn't have parking in front but that was a minor inconvience. I felt that the price was really a good deal and its getting all five stars from us seniors.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished!”
Reviews.Author: Locdal52
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving! The building doesn't look that great from the outside. We stayed in a king room and the furniture was new as well as the carpet. It was clean and you got breakfast which consisted of two kinds of cereal, instant oatmeal, bagels and cream cheese, sweet breads,muffins or toast and jams. The eating area only had four small tables but we never had a problem as we are early risers. The breakfast only goes to 9:00 am. It is right next to a Denny's so if you didn't like the breakfast choices you could eat there. It is within walking distance of Old Town (an amusement park that has a slingshot ride,etc.)

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: advocon
Reviews.Content: A perfect combination of cleanliness, location, and friendly staff. They have even updated the rooms with plasma screen tvs. Dunkin Donuts, Denny's, and Logan's Roadhouse are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place and location”
Reviews.Author: cpjmunk
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Disney I dread trying to find a clean, convenient, inexpensive hotel. We definitely found it here. Just got back from spending 4 nights here and it truly is as nice and newly updated as it looks in the pictures. New clean carpet, bedspreads, tv, nice sheets, good mattresses, everything. All clean and modern and well maintained. Spacious too. Plus the micro/frig is always a must. Everyone working there goes out of their way to be friendly. Plus when we thought we had a problem with our frig, they were up immediately to check if it was ok. It was cleaned perfectly everyday-and I'm quite fussy. The breakfast was a very nice typical motel continental breakfast of cereals, bagels, toast, 2 kinds of rolls, 2 kinds of muffins, juice, oatmeal-all you need to get you going. We found lots of motels around there have discontinued serving any kind of continental breakfast, so this was a reason we chose staying here. And the location can't be beat. It's across from Old Town, at a stoplight for ease of getting on the road. Many restaurants to walk to, Pulix grocery around the corner, Walgreens, gas station also-all very walkable. We got to Disney in about 8 minutes right down the road. Would definitely stay there again and tell anyone else to if you are looking for a very clean, well maintained, well situated motel that's very reasonably priced. Also, if you are going to Sea World-walk over to the Publix and buy your tickets there on their gift card stand. It'll save you $20 each for adults as compared to buying at the theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Disney on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights right before Christmas, We usually stay on Disney Property, but decided not to pay the 400+ a night. So we tried a Super 8, for 55.00 and 100.00 Christmas Eve. I was skeptical at first having never stayed in one before, but the price was right, and it is close to Disney. We were extremely happy to find a very nice, remodeled, clean and comfortable room with a fridge and microwave. The beds were very comfortable. Lots of parking. A very good buffet next door, and publix behind it, all within walking distance. also a pharmacy two blocks away. We have planned our next trip over spring break and once again are going to stay at this Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay - Best value in Kissimmee!”
Reviews.Author: FL_Adrienne
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this lodging in 3 years. I've never had a bad experience and the rooms are very nice for $50 -/+ per night. The hotel is just around the corner from a Publix grocery store, so you can walk there, pick up some food/beverages and walk right back to your room. The wait staff is always friendly and I've never seen this hotel crowded. It's a shame because I think it's a shining gem compared to the nearby hotels that charge much more for equal accomadations. Give it a try - your wallet will thank you.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice, clean and secure"”
Reviews.Author: FromPeru11
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about staying in here, but it was the best thing i could have done. I stayed for 15 days and i had no problems at all. The room was clean and it has everything you need, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, tv, fridge... Theme parks are really near and if you want to buy tickets, there's a place in front of the hotel, where you can get a good deal. Breakfast was more than i spect...they offer bread, butter, jelly, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea, cream cheese, bagels, muffins... They have laundry service...and even though the machines were a little bit old...they work well. And you have many places to eat just in a short walk...and also a Publix next to you. I'm going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn C
Reviews.Content: Clean and very roomy rooms. Very pleasant staff. Very close to everything and two restaurants within walking distance. Continential breakfast was very nice with a nice assortment of teas, coffees, cereals and pastries. Pool was clean and spacious. Pricing was very, very, affordable. Next return trip we will stay here again...Thank you Super 8 staff for a very pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Haha212
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a bit noisy (due to this location) but worth to stay. Just a five minute drive to Disney. Old Town on the other side of the street, Denny's in front of the motel, beside a Publix supermarket and all other shops and restaurants on US192 nearby. Nice and friendly staf and a good breakfast. Room was clean the only thing to complain about is the late housekeeping. Returning at 4-5pm to our room, several times during the week, housekeeping wasn't ready.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value- excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_9
Reviews.Content: We had a blast being in this hotel. Very well located, you can walk to the Publix Supermarket and have dinner or coffee nearby. We didn't have to drive more than 10 minutes to Disney Downtown or Parks. Clean and renovated rooms, not a big breakfast but worked for us- (toaster,juice,coffee, milk, cereal, bagel, bread, cream cheese, jelly, donuts...) , refrigerator and microwave in the room helped us to have a little snack time after a full day at parks. Friendly service. For sure we'll be back, it is a fantastic value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this price”
Reviews.Author: Shirubia13
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this motel and visited Disney Parks and Universal Studios. For this very low price its great! Location is perfect, you are in some minutes on the highway or all good Parks. Around Super 8 Motel you have shopes, diners and a lot of possibilities to eat something without driving the car. The room was modern, clean and have big space. TV and Free WLAN are available. The Pool is more a joke, but you really have no Time for this and the breakfast is also a joke, but doesnt matter. Dennys are Next to you or a dunkin donuts..so I would come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tellemarie
Reviews.Content: I decided to give this hotel a shot as I knew the location was amazing and the reviews only had glowing things to say about this place. However more than likely I will not be going back even with the fantastic price. The first room they put me in did have updated everything however the bathroom was very dirty. I asked that they just send someone to clean it but they said they could only have me change rooms as they never had housekeeping on hand that late (it was around 5-6pm). The room they moved me into had an updated vanity area and TV however the tub was yellow from the "hard water" (which after living in the area I knew about the water however if I cleaned my tub regularly never had the issue) and the rest of the appliances were quite old. I sat on the beds and they were ridiculously hard and after having so many issues already I went to the front desk. The man there was incredibly condescending, saying he'd never had a complaint before me and that these beds were brand new and pillow top (not sure what pillow top that was, I had to use a pillow under my waist the entire trip to be remotely comfortable). I knew I wouldn't get my money back as I had done pre-payment so I just sucked it up and went back to the room. Every night I was woken up at ridiculous hours thanks to the Publix trucks that would deliver food and other items very early in the morning. I stayed in the courtyard "view" area - please don't make my mistake. Take something that faces the parking lot. The main portion of the hotel is on a rather deserted road and it would be MUCH quieter in that section. Wifi was come and go. I had to continually restart the internet thanks to issues with the router. They did have multiple routers throughout the hotel though so when the wifi worked, it did work well. Housekeeping would continually shut off the AC during the day (which if you know Florida, even in November that can make a room stifling hot by the end of the day) however I had no issues with things being moved excessively during my stay. There were a few issues with towels though, one night I came in to find a towel had been folded with some sort of hair/body grime ball attached to the towel (which would have been plain for anyone to see, it was a very large thing). However when I spoke with the front desk about this, a different young man was very helpful and apologized profusely. Anytime I needed help with an issue he was there and on the ball. Overall I would probably not stay here again. The price and location is amazing but unless they make things a bit more consistent I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jnoel68
Reviews.Content: After a disasterous night camping in the rain, I was so happy to see a super 8 rated in the top 30 for kissimmee. Spent sat the 29th there to dry out. Carpet looked new. Fresh paint job. Very clean room. Even the covered mattresses looked like they had just been installed. Best of all, it was only $40 for the night. Didn't get the breakfast. Don't understand the folks whining about the coffee or breakfast. It's $40 people. Go to dennys if you want a big breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great breakfast to start a day at the park”
Reviews.Author: adventuretraveler090
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and what you would expect of a Super 8. The pool looked beautiful, but if you're spending the day at Disney, the pool won't be open when you're back. The breakfast had no nutrious options and a staff member was standing in the corner, watching you eat. There was very little choice of food, not even toast or a toaster oven.

Reviews.Title: “OK place for the money”
Reviews.Author: jonchaley
Reviews.Content: Breakfast isn't good, coffee horrible. Rooms are very nice and clean and renovated. No exercise room. Irksome "safe charge" in addition to room fee. Decent place for the money...

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyMcKinney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location before and plan on staying there this weekend. In a great central lcation to all disney and kissimee attractions this nice little hotel is just right! Rooms are clean and modern -non smokers must insist on a non smoking room - we do not use this hotel for the pool as it is in the parking lot but it is clean and everything else is great. friendly staff. we stay here because of the price and its location to all the attractions. we get up and leave and come back to relax and sleep - nice courtyard. No breakfast but there are tons of breakfast places around. Again if you are looking for the Ritz this is not your hotel but if you want a clean, easy to locate and inexpensive place to stay then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, clean & comfortable and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Maureen W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Super 8 Kissimmee for two nights and the room was excellent. Looked exactly like the photo. The staff were very friendly. The location is great - almost opposite Old Town and very near to various restaurants catering for all tastes and budgets. Also easy access to I-4. We would definitely stay there again if we were in the area. Well done to the staff of the Super 8 Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “No service from the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry M
Reviews.Content: I called to verify my reservations and was told it was a pool side king. I asked if first floor and was assured it was. Check in at 12:30 when I got to town but room wasn't ready. Asked to see room, was told I could not. I said okay I was going to Disney World and would return late. They assured me that would be okay. When I returned they said I would get their last king which was on the second floor on the pool side but you had to walk to the end of the motel to stairs and then across the cuble parking lot to the small pool. I told them that evening I needed to check out on Saturday AM instaed of Sunday morning and they chraged my cred card the full amount. I questioned it and they told me that I booked on line and there was no way they could refund me since it was done on line. They said to get adjustments from the online place. I called them and they said that I would need to get the adjustment from the motel since they were the ones which had charged my credit card. I went back to the front desk. Iwas discovered that what ever they told me at the front desk was wrong and they refused to work with me any way. The room was clean and nice. Only complaint about the four day stay are: 1) the valve stem caps were stolen off my wheels, 2) the faucet was loose in the tub, and 3) the managment of this hotel was impossible to work with for me. I paid for a room they gave to someone else! I paid for five nights and stayed fur nights. I stay at Super 8 all the time and over the last fifty years I've never had this problem. Jerry Miller

Reviews.Title: “Best Super 8 I have every stayed at, will return!”
Reviews.Author: McCall E
Reviews.Content: I don't say this very often about Super 8 Motel chains but this place has to be the king of Super 8 franchise! The price was too good to be passed up! At $38 per night I was expecting bare bones amenities and below par service. So you must imagine I was surprised that it is not only NOT bare bones but has a wide range of amenities. It has a nice adequate pool for enjoying after hitting one of Orlando's many theme parks and a microwave and mini refrigerator in every room plus a large flat screen TV. The rooms themselves are spacious and very clean. The decor is modern and what I would expect from a much pricier 3 star motel. We spent a total of 6 nights and had the room cleaned twice by some very kind staff, who did notable and professional work. The person behind the desk was not only interested about where we were from but gave great tips on what park to go to on what day, how early to arrive and what to see first to maximize our stay at Disney. We spent 2 days at the beaches, we set off for Cocoa Beach one day and Vero Beach another. Both times they helpfully checked our Map Quest directions to and from both destinations and even gave us short cuts to bypass a few tolls! Each morning we were greeted to coffee/tea, juices, danish, muffins, bagels (with creme cheese and cold cereal and a newspaper. This was enough for me while my friend would have enjoyed a bit more. However, other than the more than fare prices, the entrance to Walt Disney World is a 2 mile drive away! It is also in a good area to pick up some cheap souvenirs for people at home (including Disney products for half off) and a plethora of everything you could want Florida! There is also a grocery store 500 meters from the motel itself, which came in handy more than once. Overall, my friend and I were pleasantly surprised would come back next time in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: HouCuseChickie
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable, safe, and clean room close to the Disney Maingate for 1 night. We'd be spending the next handful of nights at a Disney resort, but needed something super close so we could be at our Disney hotel by 7:15am and a prepark opening breakfast shortly after that...but also close enough that the kids didn't have to be up too early. We were at the Maingate in about 3 min from departing from the Super 8. As for the hotel itself- the rooms appear to have been recently renovated and are much nicer than you'd expect for such a low price. The room was fairly clean minus 2 issues: 1) there was a greasy hand swipe down the bathroom wall in the area behind the door 2) there were two clumbs of old spider webs with dead bugs in them up in the entry and rear room corners. Sounds big, but they really weren't glaring issues- just things I noticed towards the end. Beyond that- it was clean and quiet and convenient to many dining and entertainment options on Irlo Bronson. As previously noted, we had an early breakfast in the parks, but I was informed that they also offer a complimentary continental breakfast- which makes this lodging an even greater value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: NYC20th
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Super 8 for 3 nights. Our room was clean and comfortable and had a fridge and microwave. The hotel is close to several restaurants varying in price range from a Subway and a Wendy's to a nice Italian restaurant which is within walking distance. There is a Publix grocery store right next door and that was very handy to buy water and breakfast foods and snacks. The hotel does offer a basic continental breakfast but only my husband tried it. This hotel is close to the theme parks and it was easy to get to them every day. The hotel is really good value. I was impressed with the quality for the money we paid for the room! It is also very much in a good location. We felt quite comfortable and safe and went out for walks in the evening. We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and great price!”
Reviews.Author: cpayne1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Super 8 Kissimmee for 1 night at the end of our Disney vacation. I paid around $38.00 for this room and I felt it was well worth it for the price. The room was clean and newly renovated. The beds are what you would expect from a Super 8 nothing special. There were no major issues. The staff was friendly at check in. Pool was small but appeared clean (we did not use it). One thing that I thought was a little crazy. There was a sign in the room that stated how many towel, washcloths and hand towels were provided in your room and the amount that you would have to pay for each item if it was not there at check out. I have never seen that before but I guess they are having problems with people taking their towels! I have no clue why they are not great by no means but what you would expect in a budget hotel. Overall we had a good stay and would stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean room at a great price for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “The Super 8 was Great...for the price.”
Reviews.Author: EdMaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Super 8 for three nights. We paid a total of $146 after taxes and fees. So that was $48 a night in June in Orlando. Not bad. The hotel itself is not much to look at, but the location was great. 5 minutes to MGM and Epcot and Animal Kingdom and 10 to the Magic Kingdom. The room was clean and it had a microwave, fridge, safe and flat screen TV. Service was good. We asked for extra towels and blankets and that was no issue. The pool is small, but clean and in the middle of the parking lot. There is a supermarket next to the back of the hotel. Was not that noisy and was very convienent to get stuff there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it sounds”
Reviews.Author: indycargirl62
Reviews.Content: We were told twice our pet could come when we talked to them on the phone when making our reservations but when we checked in they said absolutely not. We told them we talked to a lady about it and they said no women worked there but when we went for breakfast (which was basic) the next morning we found that 2 women were working there. One day out of our stay they did not clean our room nor bring us any clean towels or linens. To top it all off, they were not apologetic in the least. I guess you could say they could've cared less. Be careful of your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: hopefulp
Reviews.Content: Great place, very reasonable. The place was packed but I never heard a thing for 7 nights. Read other reviews about which side of the motel to stay on. Pool side was nice because my car was in front of my door, but the backside offered a certain amount of charm and privacy. Many restaurants, Walgreens, grocery store within walking distance. I'll stay here again. Got great rates by reserving a couple months in advance. All employees were impressive. Pool is tiny but Orlando is so great to explore that it made no difference. Melbourne beach is 50 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: Dygnifyn
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean. Low water pressure in the shower, at least in the handicap accessible room. Breakfast had a small selection of pre-packaged bagels and pastries as well as cereal. Odd $1 charge per night at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: FerasAlswairky
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family 7 nights in Super 8 Kissimmee at the Maingate. I must admit that I have read quite nice reviews about it before I booked it. And it was as expected. Nothing turned us down. It was a perfect stay. The location is awsome! Breakfast has only Cakes, Toast, sometimes spread cheese and Corn Flake. Nice one. The WiFi was perfect and free. The Pool is nice and clean. No noise at all in the Hotel. The rooms are all accessible but safe in the meantime. Our room had a table and chairs in front of its door. 10 meters from Denny's! 50 meters walking from Old Town! Very near to Disney Maingate A lot of Gift shops around! Good housekeeping!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ELJAY62
Reviews.Content: We had planned a just short stay like a couple of days in the Kissimmee area, so we tought an inexpensive motel Super 8 would do fine. Afterwards, we were so pleased with the beautiful new refurnished rooms, the very friendly approach and the great service that we decided to stay more than a week (9 days). We certainly can recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: telli38
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. I am surprised Super 8 had such a quality hotel. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Quality for the price, Loved my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kfinn85
Reviews.Content: I came down for the Super 8 Regional training conference. I paid 103 bucks for two nights. The rooms were very clean and conatined a flat screened television, micro/fridge, and a safe. Their matresses are WONDERFUL, I hardly wanted to get out of the bed! Thier pool was very clean.All staff including housekeeping that I encountered were very pleasant people. I definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Therinian
Reviews.Content: This Super 8 is the closest to Walt Disney World's "Maingate"; it's also directly behind a Publix (it's a 2-minute walk), in the same parking lot as a Denny's, and across the street from Old Town. My kids and I stayed here April 25-May 1, 2011. We used the Lynx bus system to take us to and from Disney every day. One bus stop is in front of the hotel (The other across the street) and it took us right to the Ticket & Transportation Center (Link #56). Buses run every 30 minutes (from 6 a.m-11:30 p.m.) and cost $2 per person (not the $1 stated on the Super 8 website), one way. There is a small pool (with a restroom & soda machine) in the parking lot (enclosed by a tall fence, with a handful of plastic deck chairs), as well as washers, dryers, and an ice machine on the second floor. Washing costs $2 per load, drying $1.50. Breakfast consisted of muffins, toast, pastries, coffee, juice, cereal, milk, but if you walk across the parking lot to Sizzlin Grill (on the other side of Denny's), you can get a good all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet for $3.99 per person. We ate there several times! The rooms are standard issue, but very clean, and the beds are comfortable, and the a/c unit was easy to manage; it was also nice to have a microwave and fridge in the room. The maid service was very honest and thorough, and even folded my kids' pajamas and put their stuffed animals on the pillows! The front-desk staff was friendly and never had a problem with my asking for quarters for the washer/dryer (you can also purchase sodas or laundry supplies from them for $1 each) or when I needed extra cups or $1s for the bus. If looking for cheap Florida souvenirs, there are two places between Sizzlin Grill and a McDonalds, all located on the same side as this hotel. Despite the close proximity of the highway and the supermarket, it was very quiet in the courtyard area; requesting a room on that side made a difference. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the money!”
Reviews.Author: RC2003
Reviews.Content: Would definatley stay here again. Rooms were recently renovated and are very clean and nice. Lots to do in the area, close to Disney. Really couldn't have asked for more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Super 8 yet.”
Reviews.Author: vivvy54
Reviews.Content: Booked into another Super 8 near International Drive, but when we got there it was scruffy and dirty so we cancelled it and drove to Kissimmee. Called in here by chance and so glad we did, what a nice place. The room was spotless and beautifully refurbished, comfy bed and nice staff. Very impressed by the design of the furnishings, high spec materials everywhere. There were plug sockets just where you need them, there's a safe provided and the linens were good. The bathroom isn't up to the standard of the main room, but it's really clean and that's the main thing. Pool is quite large with 4 or 5 loungers, plus shaded table/chairs. Location is great, opposite Old Town and very close to a Dennys. I'd certainly stay again, would have no problem spending a week here instead of a regular hotel. All in all, a great couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Disneyworld.”
Reviews.Author: rockchick04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week back in Feb around President's Day. Felt like we got a great deal through Expedia (use those Expedia coupons out there!) and the location was wonderful. From the airport, we were able to take a bus to the Disney Transportation Center and then another bus that let us out across the street from the Super 8. Rooms were fine. We really liked that there was a microwave and a fridge in the room, made for a great way to keep some evening snacks/dinner without going out to eat. We didn't really care for the safe fee charge. Breakfast included some packaged bagels and small muffins and some cereal, but it was good enough for us. One of the biggest draws of this hotel was that the city bus stopped right in front of it. A quick walk to the bus stop and 15 minutes later, we were at the Disney transportation center. This was great for us as we didn't rent a car and realized that it would have been a waste of money if we had. Very convenient to get to Disneyworld with the city bus at 2 bucks each way. However, if you want to get to Universal, you will probably need to take a taxi or rent a car. We were on the side of the hotel with the Publix and the trucks did start their deliveries around 5AM or so. If you are a light sleeper, I do not recommend this side. I'd say I'm a medium sleeper and when they slammed their truck doors, it woke me up. However, the location and value couldn't be beat and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “"Safe Fee" still being charged!”
Reviews.Author: TruthBeKnown
Reviews.Content: I ended up canceling my reservation at this property after discovering that it is still charging a nightly fee ($1.75 according to the employee with whom I spoke) for use of the in-room safe. Seriously? Is it really necessary to nickel-and-dime your customers this way? While this isn't as absurd as some of the resort fees charged by many motels and hotels in the area, in a way it's worse because guests are less likely to complain about it. After all, it's less than $2 per night, right? However, if you multiply this fee by the number of booked room-nights in a month's period, it makes for a tidy extra profit for the motel. Because it's a lower end property competing with other similar properties, a couple of bucks per night more might make someone book elsewhere, so I guess the answer is to just screw your customers by charging a hidden fee. When I emailed the property asking if they would waive the fee for my one night's stay, I received no response, so I cancelled my reservation and booked elsewhere. Here's a message to all hotel/motel/resort owners, managers, and accountants who read this: your customers are sick and tired of these shady fees! Build them into your room rate! We will do the research online and find out who's doing this, and you will have more empty rooms because of it!

Reviews.Title: “Motorcycles and pillows”
Reviews.Author: RetiredRichP
Reviews.Content: Noise from other patrons who parked their harlies next to their room. Instead of walking their bikes out of respect to others that may be asleep at 2 am, they loudly rode them back there......no class. The pillows in the room were worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: lpmsg
Reviews.Content: Just needed a room for one night so based on other reviews chose this one but would stay here here again any time.Proximity to Old Town was main draw but this hotel is perfect and would reccoment it to anyone who wants a nice hotel at a great price especially with children when you are out all day but still need to entertain them at nighttime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base”
Reviews.Author: CAnderson17
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel thanks to the other reviews on this site - and on other sites. The hotel was inexpensive, quiet, and clean. We really only needed a bed and a shower, but the rooms were comfortable enough to hang out in if we chose. There is a Denny's right next door, a grocery store behind and a little shopping/arcade/amusement park across the street. There is also a Walgreens about a block down which was great for those toiletries I forgot to pack! The staff was great too. I would recommend you get a better breakfast elsewhere, especially if you are going for a busy day. They do have coffee, juice and some danishes and bagels. I didn't expect more, just a heads up. There is a fridge and microwave in the room which was great for meals on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly AND Affordable”
Reviews.Author: leecinho
Reviews.Content: We have two teenagers and the only time our family uses the room is to sleep and get ready in the morning. They have obviously remodeled the rooms, good decor, nice flat screen, very comfy bed, microwave and refridgerator. The staff was super great and the room was SO affordable. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean, basic room, but NOISY!!!”
Reviews.Author: pragmatist1
Reviews.Content: Excellent room for the price - clean, decent beds, recently renovated, minifridge, microwave, in-room safe, cable TV, free Wifi, very basic continental breakfast. HOWEVER, there is a Publix supermarket right in back of the motel, and the very loud noise from the loading dock began at 5 AM. In addition, the rooms have no soundproofing - we could hear people conversing outside. Also, the pool is a tiny tank in the parking lot with fencing. So if you just want a room for the night, and are an early riser, it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: spinx1949
Reviews.Content: This hotel has up dated all there rooms we where pleased with our room and the friendly staff. we will definitely stay there again on our return trip.Great location acrossed the street from Old Town and has a Denny's restaurant out front.

Reviews.Title: “extremely noisy , you won't sleep!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMaciel
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend, you will find a clean room, nice rates, well located, but the AC it's extremely noisy, just have automatic option, and it turn off and on every five minutes, you won't sleep, have trucks load all night long. Believe me, just go if you are deaf impaired.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a one night stay, but bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfromDixie
Reviews.Content: We overnighted here on our way to our package at Disneyworld. It was incredibly inexpensive and relatively easy to find, not a bad place, pretty basic. I would not have wanted to walk around the area by myself, although I really don't think it was that bad, it was just late and dark when we arrived. The front desk clerk was pleasant and friendly, but insisted that we pay a $50 "damage fee" when we checked in. This was crazy, because the fee was refunded the next morning without anyone checking to see if we had damaged the room! Our room was pretty standard, not anything fancy, but clean and sufficient with plenty of hot water. However, it was located right next to a loading dock, where large trucks pulled in and out, loading and unloading ALL NIGHT! We had planned to leave early the next morning to head on to Disney and with all the noise, had left before our wakeup call came. A small breakfast was also served in the lobby before we left. We probably wouldn't stay here again because of the noise, otherwise it would be fine for a one night stay if we were heading somewhere else the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Almost too good to be true”
Reviews.Author: opn2nethng
Reviews.Content: I'll admit that I was leary at first. The rate was only 30 something a night so I expected it to be flawed, but it wasn't. The room/furniture was modern and clean. The service was good. The location was great. We didn't have to use our car at all while we stayed there. We were able to walk to where ever we had to go. We caught the bus to Disney for only $2.00 as it stopped right in front of the hotel. My only gripe (which isn't really a gripe at all) is that the breakfast was a little skimpy and you weren't allowed to take anything up to your room. But for the price, I can live with that. I will definitely remember this hotel for the next time we're in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edbljr
Reviews.Content: I was greeted cheerfuly the night I arrived. The front desk clerk was very friendly. The room was in excellent shape. Clean, modern, all amenities worked. Large screen HD TV. I will return to this Hotel. The check out front desk clerk also very friendly. Complimentary continental breakfast was very basic. Not worth the walk to the front desk in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Super value for an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: FL_Adrienne
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Wow! The value for this hotel is splendid. The rooms are great, clean, and big. All of this in the heart of Kissimmee. It is right next door to a Publix grocery store, so you can walk there for your dinner or any supplies you might need. The room had a refrigerator for keeping food good. You can walk to anything because you are in the heart of the life of Kissimmee. I have been here several times with mom and my fiance and we are never disappointed. The free breakfast in the morning hit the spot, too! Best part is, you're about 10-15 mins from the Disney parks and you didn't blow tons of money on a resort so you can spend more money in the park :)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Let The Nice Photo Deceive You !!!”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights. Surprised that we could endured our stay. Let me start with the pro , the room's furniture is as nice as those photo shows in the website. The management is so proud of it that it has a flat screen tv at the reception counter, showing the nice pictures of the room. If you buy the idea ...that's it... Now, let me share the pain we've gone through. When we entered the room, it smelled musty. The room interior is refurbished but not the toilet, the steel handle in the bath tub is rusted. Now come to the most important part that bothered us, the bedding! We were so surprised when we look at the pillows. We have 2 Queen beds, 2 pillows on each bed. All four of them are of different sizes and material made. All covered by pillow cases that have gone through perhaps thousand wash cycle, as thin as 1 ply of tissue paper. The colour has changed to grayish white. The pillow cases is 2 sizes smaller than the pillow, so...you can imagine, the pillows looked squashed like lumpy sausages with thin and disgusting looking pillow cases. The blankets are the thin brown one, with one layer of white sheet underneath. and again, the white sheets are not white and as thin as 1 ply of tissue paper, I called the front desk, I was willing to pay for an upgrade, if a better pillow cases and blankets covers are used in the poolside room. I was told the whole property use the same quality of bedding. I wanted to cancel my stay, but no refund was allowed. We have paid for 6 nites. Because of that, we have to stay on. The front desk said, the most he could do was giving me another 2 pillow cases and 2 more white sheets for the blankets. We collected from the front desk....true..what we got from him is the same as those in the room. Throughout our 7 days stay, there was one or 2 days we were lucky to get pillow cases which are a little bit whiter, or bigger in sizes. But most of the days, we get back the poor thin one. There is no consistency If you stay for only one nite and you are lucky to get the not so bad beddings, may be you will feel better than us. Another thing, the base unit of the bed (divan) has no cover, may be it is to save cost, another thing is perhaps it's for showing off the brand of the beds. One more important thing, the aircond has no control of fan speed, so, it will blow right to your face while sleeping on the bed. We got sick because of that. The air from the aircond smells musty too Now, for breakfast. I think breakfast here is the most "budget minded" one that we have ever encountered. 2 type of cheapest cereal and cold milk. packed small muffin, sweet danish and bagel. White bread, butter , jam and cream cheese. Coffee & tea, no hot chocolate. Apple & orange juice from the machine. We ate bagel with butter everyday. I did come across bagel that's as hard as rock which I had to throw it away. The other reviewer is true, the management has no concern for the guests. They have a lot more to learn about good attitude in hospitality. We are your paying guests, we are not baggers. Well, please think very hard before you make the decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yankees2009
Reviews.Content: Pro- Nice TV, good location. Cons-FEE'S!!!!!, Refrig is stuck at one temp, froze everything. Micro didn't work. Bathroom had water on floor coming from tub every day. Didn't cleam room one day and said I left "do not disturb" sign on door, which I never did since I didn't have one to leave... Web site said I would have a couch in room, NO couch... Web site said they do NOT charge CC until check-out, again another LIE. Maid kept pushing for tips.... Management doesn't care about you once your paid, which is why they LIE and make you pay from the 1st day. Better hotels nearby that CARE about their customers....

Reviews.Title: “We were surprized”
Reviews.Author: gafffremd
Reviews.Content: The first time we have stay at a Super 8 and it will NOT be our last, It was very clean and seem to be well kept , Staff seem to be glade to see you and was willing to help anyway they could, We will stay here again if back in that area !!

Reviews.Title: “HIdden FEES hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctvalenti
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night until we met up with Family . The hotel is clean and has flat screen TV's however, the smoke alarm was hanging off the wall by wires. The Door did not lock securely we had to place a chair in front of the door. Plus the Hotel made us pay $1.07 for a safe per night even though we didn't use it. It's standard in the rooms. Additionally, if you book on a website the hotel charges you a $100.00 hold on your Credit Card for "damages or Thefts" to your room.The beds were not great and the Air Conditioner was a unit which was not on when we arrived. BAD hotel I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Goood Motel”
Reviews.Author: Nicolpau
Reviews.Content: This is a very good motel. Very clean. Inexpensive. The management and staff are an indian family very competent and very friendly. If you need a cozy place to stay it is the best you can find. Very close to restaurants and walking distance to a great supermarket Publix.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Motel! "”
Reviews.Author: Bryan2008
Reviews.Content: The reviews where great, But is it true?? How can they offer large rooms with 2 queen beds, rooms and furniture like NEW for so cheap?? Thats what i was asking myself, buts its true!! Its an older Motel, but they have put allot of loving care into taking care of there guests and property. Very polite and took care of all our needs. Yes they do charge for the safe, but they are a good quality and well worth the small fee . Their free breakfast is very small for our liking so we recommend Ponderosa, Dennys and Sizzlers which are within walking distance and offer a great buffet breakfast for $3.99 and $4.99. We liked the Ponderosa as the people where exceptionally Friendly!! We stayed on the pool side as we heard the garbage trucks and delivery trucks on the other side where noisy at night. Never heard a thing!! If you are budget minded and don't mind staying in an older Motel with a personality I highly recommend this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: hcbj
Reviews.Content: During our roadtrip througe the US, my partner and I stayied here for 7days. The room was big (King bedroom) clean, and with 1,5MB wireless internet. The AC system could keep the room very cold during the day! The motel has a descent pool area, during our stay many smaller kids used the pool. Room service everyday at 10:00AM nothing to complain about here! From 6:00AM-9:00AM there is free breakfast not a big buffet, but just enough to get you started in the morning. We used the self-service landury, which worked fine 2$ pr wash. One thing to mention, we heard for otheres that the west side of the motel was noisy at night. Just next to the motel there is Grocery store "Publix", who gets goods at night. So ask to get at room at the east side! If you want to shop, go to Primium Outlet not Florida Mall they are much more expensiv than the outlet. !!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, recently updated rooms, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: familyoffour1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July. Room interiors were nicely updated and very clean and included a refrigerator and microwave, a granite-type counter, newer bath/shower combo, flat screen TV, 2 queen sized comfortable beds, and newer furniture/carpet. Also, had a newer A/C unit with digital display which kept us comfortable even though it was quite hot and humid outside. Very good wi-fi connection, too. Very courteous and friendly staff. Continental breakfast consisted of a variety of muffins, pastries, bagels, toast, juice, coffee, and 2 types of cereal/milk. Motel sits next to the back of a Publix supermarket, so there was noise from emptying dumpsters and box compactors off and on from about 4:30am most mornings...enough to only awaken me, but not my husband or sons. Good location for the Disney parks. Plan to go to a water park if you want to spend some time at a pool. The pool here is quite small and is in the parking lot. Exterior of the motel is a bit tired, the pillows could have been fluffier, but all in all, a very good value. This is not a resort, but is a nice clean, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price - nice rooms and hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: PJStephens
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was for the low nightly rate. The room was very clean and looked to have new furniture, including a fridge and a microwave. The breakfast and lobby area were spotless and the pool was also well maintained. If you are looking for a low cost room that is very close to the main gate of Disney, we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: br4zili4ndud3
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm from Brazil and I stayed there in March 2010, during my vacation in Orlando. The room was clean and very comfortable and the place has decent amenities, such as free WiFi, free parking, microwave/fridge and the continental breakfast, which is simple but satisfactory. Not to mention it's conveniently located nearby most of the attractions. Highly recommended for travelers looking for a nice and cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noise was beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: karemore
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before booking and assumed we could handle the noise from the Publix nearby. The supermarket ENTRANCE is across a parking lot from this hotel, but the back of the store is just a couple yards from the "courtyard" rooms. It's much closer than the reviews made it sound. The delivery trucks come at all times of the night and early morning. There are also stores and restaurants extremely close which seemed to have frequent garbage pickup. These trucks all have those loud backing warning sounds which penetrate the rooms even more than the banging and other noises. Normally we drown out noise with the a/c or fan, but that was as bad as the trucks if not worse. I have never stayed in a motel with such a loud a/c unit. We couldn't sleep with it on, not even just with the fan blowing. I am sure that staying poolside is a completely different experience. Pay the extra money for a room on that side if you plan to stay here. The staff was great. The room was large and modern. The breakfast wasn't worth the trip to the office, but the Publix had plenty of variety and there was a Denny's a couple yards in front of the motel. The pool wasn't open when we did want to use it. A sign said it was closed due to wet paint. That was disappointing but didn't spoil our stay. The location of the motel was great. It was a short easy drive to Sea World, Magic Kingdom, and Downtown Disney. I'd say everything in the other reviews is accurate, but I didn't realize the noise on the courtyard side would spoil our stay. After a full day in a park, we needed a good night's sleep, and we did not have that at the Super 8 because of the noise from outside and from the a/c unit.

Reviews.Title: “Place was great! No one in the group had any complaints”
Reviews.Author: phendr6319
Reviews.Content: Parking was well lighted, Rooms were extremely modern. (2) Queen Beds, granite countertop, micro, refrig Flat screen TV. Clean & odor free. Comfortable beds, staff very accomodating. Staff was more than leasant and helpful. Did all they could to accomodate our group of 14 making the stay at this hotel a great one. The price was more than fair & well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Good Rooms - Low Price”
Reviews.Author: Konacq
Reviews.Content: Based on other TripAdvisor reviews, I booked this hotel while visiting nearby theme parks, and was very pleased. I booked 3 rooms for 3 days - 8 people total. Nothing fancy, but excellent value. Pros: Clean, reasonably well kept, new furniture, TV & carpets, quiet room (except for AirCon), fast WiFi, comfortable beds, close to theme parks, located close to many restaurants, everything works, friendly check-in service. Cons: Noisy AirCon, swimming pool in dead middle of parking lot (really!) Manager let me park my 17' trailer in the parking lot at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Best in town”
Reviews.Author: icellc
Reviews.Content: We came into Kissimmee for one night stay and this is one of the nicest hotels. Very modern very clean very nice staff. We had to stay another night so we came back to Super 8

Reviews.Title: “Good room, few irritants”
Reviews.Author: Vivekbrata
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positives. 1. The hotel is situated in a decent location. We traveled to Sea World and Disney Magic Kingdom and Downtown from here - and the location is convenient. In the same compound they have Bennigans and Dennys, and a large Publix supermarket. There is also a Walgreens outlet within walking distance. 2. The room was large. 3. The room is obviuosly refurbished and looks good with nice furniture. Had a large flat screen LCD TV. Now the negatives: 1. The heater was erratic. It was COLD in Orlando when we stayed there - temperature varied between 30s and 50s throughout the day. And the first night the heater hardly worked. We did not have any problems from the next day onwards though. 2. The towels provided were worn out and some of them were stained. 3. They charge you $1/day for a safe in the room. While I feel that is accepted, it is unethical not to mention that upfront at the time of reservation . I was surprised but still accepted the charge thinking that I could use the same to store our passports and the laptop, which we originally did not plan to. However, the safe did not work. I mentioned this at the time of check-out to the person at the desk. However he still charged me for the safe saying that I should have called him up when it did not work. How much time should I spend on something which I had not even wanted? I found this entire thing very immoral and unacceptable. At just for a dollar a day, I call it "Penny wise pound foolosh". 4. This can be considered as my own fault. Room on the second floor, no elevator, lots of luggage. I had a hard time taking the suitcases up and down. 5. Breakfast was very basic. Coffee, Juice, Milk and cheerios, bread and danish. 6. The swimming pool is a joke for the size of the hotel. While we were there, there was no scope of using it, though. However, looking at the location, size of room and cleanliness, I would still recommend this to my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great value in super location”
Reviews.Author: KentRatchet
Reviews.Content: After staying in the same location in a couple of very run down hotels, how refreshing it was to find such a clean and modern hotel at such a great rate. The rooms were equipped with microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Breakfast was a very basic offering and not worth getting up for and the walls are typical of so many hotels for sound proofing, if you have considerate neighbors great, if not you can hear quite a lot. Yes they do charge a $1.00 a day for the in room safe, which i found reassuring to have and there is a sign in reception notifying you of this charge, added to the great rate it is still a bargain. The location is fantastic, just across the road from Old town and walking distance to some great eateries. Would i stay there again, you bet , try to find as clean and central for that sort of money!

Reviews.Title: “Best for the money”
Reviews.Author: patdo
Reviews.Content: For 43$ CAN per night you could expect bad things to happen to you... but it was a nice surprise to find a completely refurbished hotel with new and VERY comfy beds, older but CLEAN bathroom. The continental breakfast was rudimental but the hotel is litterally a 30 seconds walk to a Publix grocery store where you can get fruits and pastries for your breakfast or freshly made sandwiches from the deli. There is also a Denny's restaurant right in the parking lot of the hotel. We went to Orlando to visit the attraction parks and only for that so the room was basically a place to sleep and shower. The front desk staff was very helpful and generous of their time. We travelled to The Disney theme parks by public bus (2$ per passenger, the bus stop is right in front of the hotel) Visit the LYNX orlando website for info. We had to take a MEARS shuttl to Universal studios but it was worth it (they picked us off at the time WE wanted... great if you want to spend more time at Citywalk). You can also easily reach Medieval Times by bus. The Room on the Publix's side may get a litle noisy with the delivery trucks so if you're a light sleeper just request a room poolside. Also, a woman mentionned that her room was next to the ice machine and it did get noisy. The pool was smaller but again it is an hotel you mostly go to sleep, it is not a resort. The area felt safe and the driver of the shuttle that took us from the airport seemed to think so. If you go there, do go to Logan's BBQ (2 minutes walk) The best ribs in the world!!! On the other side of the street from Super 8 you can visit Old Town (5 minutes walk) I would go back no question about it :)

Reviews.Title: “$1.50 per day mandatory safe charge, used or not”
Reviews.Author: girlsheri1
Reviews.Content: We requested a second room after inspecting our first room and the bathroom light wasn't working. We had to call the management on our second room because the mircowave kept beeping. They had to bring us another one. The mandatory safe charge, is just not right. We were very upset about this added nightly charge. The safe fee should be added into the room rate before booking! The grocery store is next door and noisy. It was nice the rooms had been remodeled. There is a Denney's next to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Southmove
Reviews.Content: First return stay in several years. Rooms renovated very tastefully, very convenient to local attractions and dining. Occasionally a bit noisy on the courtyard side, due to Publix, but not a disqualifying factor, for us, anyway. Courtyard very tastefully done, could use a first floor ice machine for the mobility challenged. Staff very cheerful, friendly and helpful. Many businesses in the area don't appear to care about repeat business. These folks absolutely demonstrate that they do. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “`Surcharge Hall of Shame'”
Reviews.Author: bullfrog09
Reviews.Content: This motel would get a good grade for location and clean rooms ...however the management has decided to add a mandatory room safe fee at checkout. I neither wanted nor needed a safe. Their response.. a safe in every room controlled by the guest whether you want one or not. I researched the booking site and super 8 web pages for small print and found none. Ambitious management being "slick" is the message here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: marklynpa
Reviews.Content: This was a convenient location for our 2 day visit to WDW. Our non-smoke 2qn bed room was clean and nicely furnished. This is an excellent value for budget lodging. Booked again for later in the month.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, But Good”
Reviews.Author: Sudlow
Reviews.Content: I can't add much to the other reviews, but this place will be my first choice to stay the next time I'm in the area. For someone just using the room to sleep, it is great. I used the AAA discount and paid $42/night including tax. The free wi-fi in the room is great. I stayed on the side closest to the Publix supermarket and Harley dealer. the AC covered any noise they made. It was not the problem noted in one of the other reviews. The Publix has a deli that makes pretty good sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “One to Remember”
Reviews.Author: MiamiPaola
Reviews.Content: good service, room completly remodeled, very clean, good beds. Very closed to parks and restaurants. I liked the best the ocation, the price and the cleaness.

Reviews.Title: “Would suit all those who seek good location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ZevonUK
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room and bathroom, all rooms recently refurbished with modern units and flat screen tv, microwave and refrigerator. Air Con, very efficient. Pool looked clean and inviting, although we didn't have time to use it. Close to Celebration and Old Town. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Would recommend to anyone seeking these features.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your visiting Disney and don't want to pay too much.”
Reviews.Author: FLtrppr
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay. The rooms were updated with flat screen TV's and a nice vanity area. I am a young woman who travels by herself and is concerned about safety. I felt safe staying here. The free breakfast was less to be desired, but there are many restaurants in the area. The service was excellent and the staff was friendly. I did not have reservations, just took a chance and was very satisfied. The location was close to I-4. I would recommend this to my friends and collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, newly remodeled rooms”
Reviews.Author: befo
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms - clean and newly remodeled. Nice staff. Nice location for going to Disney. We did not spend much time in the room since we spent all day at Disney World. Pool area is small, but most guest who come here are going to Disney. Good value for the money. Great place to stay for a couple of nights :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great location for Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights. The main reason we were in the area was to go to Disneyworld, and I had naively assumed when we begun planning the trip that as Disneyworld is marketed as being in Orlando, we should stay in Orlando. But Kissimmee (for anyone who also thinks Disneyworld is in Orlando) is only 3.5 miles from Kissimmee, whereas Orlando is 20 miles away. So the location is great. Ok, you can stay at a Disneyworld resort if you really want to be right on top of the Disney action - but I was happy to stay 3.5 miles away and pay a fraction of the price of what it would cost to stay at a Disney resort. Anyway onto the room itself. It was spacious and clean. The outside of the Super 8 as you drive in doesn't look like anything special, but apparently the rooms themselves were renovated relatively recently, and it shows. They are very modern (flatscreen tvs built into the wall). The beds were very comfortable. The only drawback at this place was that the outside aircon vents seemed to be leaking, making the communal stairways going up to some of the rooms were slippery and at one point my husband nearly fell over . But who knows, maybe the hotel were aware and had already called someone in to fix it. Overall I think this place is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “BEST & CLEANEST LOW PRICE MOTEL I'VE EVER FOUND IN ORLANDO, KISSIMMEE AREA”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelallthetime
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting nearby, so I tagged along. We decided that we'd go the Value Route this time. Having read the T.A. reviews, I felt confident that we wouldn't be encountering any bugs in this motel, and my feelings proved true. In a day and age when even the best of hotels and motels are getting reviews of having critters, looking for a "bug-less" hotel has been my number one criteria when searching for a place to stay. I get heebie geebies just thinking what is "out there". This small motel right across from Old Town proved to be 100 PERCENT BUG FREE! It was also VERY CLEAN. The carpet was so new, that I actually walked barefoot on it... something I don't often do away from home. It gets 5 stars for cleanliness and bug-free. Is it a "resort"? No, not at all. Just a nice comfy, clean place to lay your head. It had a nice flat screen with what seemed to be a nice sound system / speakers. The fridge was a plus. Had a hair dryer as well. It definitely has been recently renovated, and we were pleased with everything... especially the price (around $40 a night). If you want to spend your vacation lounging around the pool, this is not for you. The pool is VERY SMALL, and located IN THE PARKING LOT on the side of the building! There wasn't enough room for lounge chairs in this tiny area, but they do have some chairs and a table with umbrella. The chairs at the pool seemed to be relatively new as well, but nowhere to "lay out" for a tan. In summary, If all you need is a place to lay your head, while going on to spend your day at theme parks, meetings, or otherwise, then this is a great bang for your buck. Most people's stays in Orlando and Kissimmee are filled with theme parks, shows at night, dining out, etc, so if that's the case, who cares what ammenities are at your motel, as long as you have a comfy and clean place to lay your head at night? I didn't check out the breakfast area, but they did have one. My brother in law had a few cups of their coffee in the morning and said it was fine. I don't know of another hotel so convenient to Disney that has rooms at this price that are not buggy, dirty or just plain worn out, or worse yet, are in areas of high crime. This motel was in a safe area, had pleasant staff, right next to a Denny's and a Publix, and convenient to EVERYTHING! Unless you are looking for luxury, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry I tipped the maids”
Reviews.Author: oktoberfest
Reviews.Content: Rooms were good for the money we paid.BUt we forgot a bag with bradnew stuff from Abercrombie&Fitch(125$) in our room, called 2 days later- nothing, we should call 2 hours later,we did. The lady in the phone was very unfriendly, she tells us if they find something they will call or email you. Nothing happens. We are sure we forgot this bag at the motel, because we go to ft. lauderdale after our visit to kissimmee and we didn t change the motel.So I have to say, everyday we tipped the maids but their best tip must be the bag we forgot.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: dpladyreed
Reviews.Content: I could not believe what a terrific deal we received for a clean, modern motel so close to Disney! I booked online, and with the $30 rebate by joining the freeTravelers Advantage program (which we promptly cancelled after our stay), the room price including tax was $33/night! Our room was recently and tastefully renovated, and everything was spotless. Nice flat screen TV, comfortable beds, and we made great use of the microwave and refrigerator. Continental breakfast was offered, but we never got it since we brought our own food. 5 minutes to Disney, and located within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The rooms were on the small side, so for a family of four, I think it might feel cramped after awhile. However, it was perfect for me and my husband. There was some construction work going on next door which began quite early in the morning. Also, the Harley shop got a bit noisy. If you ask for a room in the back corner of the building (on the same side of the building as the pool, just farther back from the highway), I think that would probably be quieter. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for our dollar.”
Reviews.Author: winterpeg4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. We were very happy with our stay! I researched many hotels online prior and chose this one because of the remodeling. Beds were new and comfortable which is important to us. Nice new decor including flat screen t.v. We also wanted a microwave and the fridge was larger than I expected. Used it alot for food we bought at the supermarket next door. Continental breakfast was typical toast/cereal/juice/coffee. We bought our own instant oatmeal and fruit to supplement. Pool is not heated but the nice days we spent at the waterparks anyway. Location was great! Right across the street from Old Town. Plenty of restaurants in the area. The price was unbelievable! I first made reservations around 6 months ago and was happy with a $65/night. Just before I left I checked online and the price dropped to $45 so I called and they changed it for me. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Slinger07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Super 8 in Kissimmee from 12/25 - 12/29. Despite having some pricing problems at check-in, the hotel turned out to be way better then we had expected. When we checked into the hotel, the manager told us that we owed more then what was listed on our confirmation email from the hotel. This was not a good way to welcome a guest, and he should have honored the email I showed him that was sent to me when we booked over the phone which had the price plainly listed. My wife wanted to call corporate immediately, but since it was Xmas day they were not open and finding another hotel on the spot would have been difficult and probably more pricey. The following day I received a message from the front desk that they had made a mistake and gave us the difference in money back. The room was very clean & modern with nice Silver/Black accents on the furniture and a very nice 32' Vizio LCD TV. Maids cleaned the room daily and we tipped them for the quality job they did. The drive to the Disney parks was only a few minutes away and the traffic was not bad at all. We have stayed on Disney property before, but even the Value Resorts will cost you around $100/night. If your looking for a clean/modern reasonably priced hotel near the Disney Parks, the Super 8 is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: connierue
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated room with new furnishings. Excellent price of $40 night. No info about free Internet, had to ask about password. The bathroom could use new fixtures. The tub drained so slow the water went up to my ankles during shower. Great location not far from Disney. Lots of restaurants and other activities within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nbaa
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for $50 plus taxes, had a twin bedded room, very clean, all facilites including a very useful fridge for drinks. Next door is a dry cleaners and a Laundromat, and lots of good eateries nearby. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. Superb

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Clean -- We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PeacemakerSr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Super 8 - Kissimmee (5875 Irlo Bronson Hwy) for two (2) nights at the end of September 2008 and were pleasantly surprised! This older motel has been completely remodeled inside the rooms with contemporary custom furnishings. The new owners were very pleasant are are constantly maintaining and upgrading. The doors were beautifully painted. We enjoyed our stay. The outdoor pool was quite small, but clean. There is no extra charge for your programmable safe. An added bonus is that if you want to buy something small for your refrigerator/microwave, you are back to back with a very nice Publix grocery store -- something we only discovered too late in our stay to take advantage of its convenience. For low rates and access to Disney this motel is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quailty Budget Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meedychesh
Reviews.Content: I have stopped in several super 8's over the years and this was the best. We didn't book, just turned up as there are several budget hotels and we figured if they were full we'd just see what other deals we could get along the road. We only planned to stop one night as it was futher out of Orlando than we had wanted to stay but handy for a night in Kissimmee Old town...We ended up stopping 3 in the end and driving further as it was great value for money. It's just over the road from the old town, plenty of parking right out front in full view of the reception desk and free coffee/muffins/toast in reception in the morning. There are supermarkets nearby and the room had two very large double beds so a much, much cheaper alternative to a villa if there are a few of you. The only downsides were carrying our heavy cases up the stairs and the walkway outside the doors could have done with a good scrub. Inside the room was faultless. The aircon worked really well and there was a coin op laundry which was ideal for drying out our clothes after getting soaked at the parks during the day. I will be staying here again next time I'm in florida.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong staying here !”
Reviews.Author: wiznvic
Reviews.Content: This is a super nice place that has just been renovated. All new furniture with a microwave, coffee pot and a larger than expected refrigerator. And not only that, the maid service is great, the place is nice and well kept, every thing is landscaped nicely and it's a super deal. Just 41.00 a night in the off season. And there is a Publix market so close that you can still walk there after a long day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and a great price.”
Reviews.Author: philipo49
Reviews.Content: We booked this place online from the UK for £90 for 3 nights and had a great stay. The place has just been renovated so it's in fantastic condition, everything is spotlessly clean and new. It is right next door to a Dennys and opposite Old Town Kissimme which is a great place to go on a Fri or Sat evening. The reception stay were very friendly and helpful all the time and the rooms were immaculate. There are only 2 minor reasons why I haven't given this place a 5/5 rating. The first is the breakfast which is very basic, it's just bagels, cofffee and a couple of cereals, but to be fair it is a 'complimentary' breakfast so we couldn't really complain. And the second reason is the location of the pool, it's right in the middle of the carpark! We paid an extra $5 per night to have poolside not realising that it is surrounded by cars half the time! Despite those two little niggles this place is a great budget place to stay, and you've got to remember that it's a Motel, not a Hotel. we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “been staying there for many yearly visit to disney the new room are very nice”
Reviews.Author: firechief_8
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at this motel since 2004 it is located next to dennys rest. and old town is across 192. only 10 minutes away from disney. we always use this property to stay at before we move to our d.v.c. property. we can stay at any motel on 192 but the staff and workers at this motel 8 are very helpfull if you have a problem with your room. can recomend this motel 8 to any one who are looking for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bella1202
Reviews.Content: This was a great motel. The beds were very comfortable. The motel was very clean. The price was very good if you are on a budget. The breakfast had pastries and cereal. We went to the Disney Parks which were about 10 minutes away. We didn't spend much time in the room, but it was very comfortable after walking in the parks all day. It is a very quiet motel and close to everything. I would recommend this motel and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Renovation”
Reviews.Author: noles103
Reviews.Content: This Super 8 obviously recently renovated and the rooms are like new! Flat panel TV's (look like 32") micro/fridge, great beds, free high speed and local calls. A very fair price for the my stay! I will stay here from now on, close to the parks and conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Bad Stay ....”
Reviews.Author: TLK93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 12/22 for 1 night. The room was free so we decided to give it a shot. The room was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. The decor was VERY nice and the flat screen TV was AWESOME. The bathroom is very small but it was clean. Our room had a microwave and mini fridge. The location was perfect; less than 10 minutes to Disney and there are tons of restaurants on192. I probably won't stay here again but it's not bad at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Kissimmee/Orlando/Maingate
HotelInfo.Address: 5875 W Irlo Bronson Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34746
